summary:
Motivated. Highly Engaged. Passionate.

I am a first-year International Business student at Avans University of Applied Sciences. My passion for marketing and my international scope brought me to Avans. My core focuses of interest currently include Marketing & Communication and Finance.

As I further my studies at Avans, I hope to gain more professional experience within the marketing and finance realms, in order to pursue my goal of becoming a marketeer. My current skillset of creativity, communication, and time management will only grow with new opportunities on the horizon.

projects.title: Produce a Short Film - Coincidence... Or Not?
projects.description:
In this project, I had to write, produce, and publish a short film called ''Coincidence.. Or Not?''. In the movie, a character misses the opportunity to go to a model casting which leads to a positive experience in her life.

I learned the following things:
- How to write a character-driven script, making use of a professional industry format, based on an original inspiration that contains the core elements of drama
- How to manage complex pre-production planning and apply technical camera, editing and audio skills in order to make a short film
- How to create a promotion plan and partially execute it in order to reach a specific audience by differentiating services from products, integrating relevant promotion tools and applying communication theories that address the emotions of my target audience
- How to handle legal issues that might arise from the project, as well as how to create simple contracts to share intellectual property, while being able to distinguish different types of intellectual property and the possible consequences of using intellectual property without permission

projects.title: Designing a Magazine - TravelerZ
projects.description:
In this project, I had to design, write, and publish a magazine for international students in the Netherlands. We came up with TravelerZ, a magazine for Gen-Z students who have the desire to travel more affordably.

I learned the following things in this project:
- How to use software like Adobe Illustrator to design various illustrations for different uses
- How to apply fundamental structural building blocks of storytelling in order to create content for a feature-driven magazine
- How to create work that targets an identified audience in order to engage committed readers
- How to use several writing techniques, specifically 'show don't tell' and established interview techniques in order to make my stories come to life for audiences
- How to modify and adjust content in appropriate formats with the best practices from the graphic design industry in order to deliver visual content for digital media products
- How to apply fundamental ideas about the practice of good visual design in order to create digital graphic products
- How to create a Situation Analysis to explain internal and external factors that influence the marketing strategy of a company
- How to make marketing objectives using the S.M.A.R.T method
- How to develop a marketing strategy by using the Segmentation-Targeting-Positioning method
- How to use the Product Planning theory to identify decision making steps for managing a product and bringing a new product to the market
- How to identify relevant pricing strategies for a media and entertainment product

projects.title: Customer Satisfaction Research - Gillette
projects.description:
In this project, I had to organize, execute, and report on a customer satisfaction survey for Gillette. 

I learned the following things in this project:
- How to remotely organize a research project in a systemic way in order to realize the project objective
- How to develop and execute a survey based on an online questionnaire in order to advise upon customer satisfaction improvement measures
- How to process and analyse quantitive data resulting from research
- The ability to understand and apply univariate statistical calculations and methods in order to draw conclusions
- How to evaluate the validity and reliability of information resulting from research in order to assess the quality of research
- How to use commonly used software (Excel) for research purposes
- How to use charts and tables correctly order to support my written and oral communication
- How to present the results of a research project in both written and oral communication

contributors.headline: Scaling businesses online, one campaign at a time  |   Digital Marketing Specialist @ Growly

projects.title: Develop a Start-Up Company - MetaBook
projects.description:
In the Start-Up project, we had to develop a company and present it to a group of investors. We developed MetaBook. We develop eco-friendly and reusable notebooks to help solve environmental issues. 

I learned the following things in this project:
- How to convince a group of investors to invest in my venture by pitching my business proposition
- Reflect in a professional way on my personal development related to my entrepreneurial mindset and capabilities

contributors.headline: Scaling businesses online, one campaign at a time  |   Digital Marketing Specialist @ Growly

projects.title: Investment Budget - Sweet Tooth
projects.description:
In the Investment Budget project, we had to help a fictional cookie company called: ''Sweet Tooth'' to expand in Austria. We had to prepare an Investment Budget for the new business, a calculation of the annual Breakeven sales, a budgeted Income Statement, and a budgeted Cash Flow Statement.

I learned the following things in this project:
- How to make a budget for a small/medium size company
- How to construct a (monthly) financial report containing a Balance Sheet, Income Statement and a Cash Flow Statement
- How to translate events & transactions into financial data
- How to use Excel as a tool to calculate/collect data and to deliver financial reports
- How to present the results of the project in writing and a separate Excel file
- How to advise upon opening a new business in another global country and city

projects.title: Master Budget Planning - Sweet Tooth
projects.description:
In the Master Budget Planning, we had to help a fictional cookie company called: ''Sweet Tooth''. We had to prepare a Master Budget for the year 2021 including a scenario analysis. 

I learned the following things in this project:
- How to make a budget for a small/medium size company
- How to construct a (monthly) financial report containing a Balance Sheet, Income Statement and a Cash Flow Statement
- How to translate events & transactions into financial data
- How to use Excel as a tool to calculate/collect data and to deliver financial reports
- How to present the results of the project in writing and a separate Excel file

projects.title: SWOT - ASML
projects.description:
In the SWOT project focussed on ASML, I learned how to collaborate with my team members and how to prioritize tasks. I worked within a team with multiple cultural backgrounds, which gave me a broader understanding of different cultures.

For this project, my tasks mainly consisted of the research of ASML and it's competitors and the accurate representation of ASML in the report.

courses.name: Culture & Ethics in Asian Business Relations

profile_positions.description:
Verkopen registreren op een kassa door artikelen te scannen.

Verantwoordelijkheden:
- Een positieve klantenservice bieden met eerlijke en vriendelijke service
- Problemen van klanten oplossen en vragen beantwoorden
- Betalingen verzamelen door verschillende soorten betaalmethoden te accepteren en wisselgeld teruggeven aan de klant

Vaardigheden: 
- Vriendelijke en positieve houding
- Uitstekende communicatieve vaardigheden
- Geld terug kunnen geven
- Aandacht voor details
profile_positions.title: Caissière

profile_positions.description:
Registering sales on a cash register by scanning items, itemizing and totaling customers' purchases.

Responsibilities:
- Provide a positive customer service with fair and friendly service
- Resolve customer issues and answer questions
- Collect payments by accepting different types of payment methods and make change for cash customers

Skills: 
- Friendly and positive attitude
- Excellent communication skills
- Ability to make change
- Attention to detail
profile_positions.title: Cashier

profile_positions.description:
Responsible for maintaining a grocery store to ensure it runs efficiently.

Responsibilities:
- Greet shoppers, answer questions, help customers find products
- Learn about new products quickly and make recommendations
- Unload daily deliveries and organize the stock room
- Stock shelves and displays
- Make sure that all products are fresh and within the expiration date

Skills:
- Collaborate with coworkers across departments
- Strong verbal communication skills
- Excellent customer service skills
